It was formulated by ](https://www.britannica.com/topic/spiritualism-religion) [Rudolf Steiner](https://www.britannica.com/biography/Rudolf-Steiner) (q.v.), an Austrian philosopher, scientist, and artist, who postulated the existence of a spiritual world comprehensible to pure thought but fully accessible only to the faculties of knowledge latent in all humans. He regarded human beings as having originally participated in the spiritual processes of the world through a dreamlike [consciousness](https://www.britannica.com/topic/consciousness). Because Steiner claimed that an [enhanced](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/enhanced) [consciousness](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/consciousness) can again perceive spiritual worlds, he attempted to develop a faculty for spiritual perception independent of the senses.
